subject: Technology
title: The Search for Life on Europa
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Search for Life on Europa.

hook.text: Jupiter's moon Europa is covered in ice. Beneath that ice lies an ocean with more water than all of Earth's.

buildup.text: Scientists believe this hidden ocean is warmed by tidal forces from Jupiter's massive gravity.

discovery.text: Water, heat, and chemical energy: Europa has all three ingredients scientists consider essential for life.

twist.text: Geysers of water vapor have been spotted erupting through cracks in the ice into space.

climax.text: NASA's Europa Clipper mission will fly through those plumes, sampling the ocean without ever landing.

punchline.text: If life exists beyond Earth, it might be hiding under ice on Jupiter's moon.

quiz.question: Why do scientists think Europa could harbor life?
options: It has a liquid ocean with water, heat, and chemical energy
It is the closest moon to the Sun
